qas.question: How many Jews were forced to live within the Warsaw Ghetto?
How many Jews died in the Warsa Ghetto?
Which group of people were considered inferior?
How many Polish people were used in labor camps?
How many people are believed to have died in Auschwitz?
How many Jews were forced to live outside of the Warsaw Ghetto?
How many Jews survived in the Warsa Ghetto?
Which group of people were considered superior?
How many Polish people weren't used in labor camps?
How many people are believed to have lived in Auschwitz?

context: Although Germany used forced labourers in most occupied countries, <a2_0><b7_0>Poles and other Slavs<b7_0/><a2_0/> were viewed as inferior by Nazi propaganda, thus, better suited for such duties. <a3_0><b8_0>Between 1 and 2.5 million Polish citizens<b8_0/><a3_0/> were transported to the Reich for forced labour, against their will. All Polish males were required to perform forced labour. While ethnic Poles were subject to selective persecution, all ethnic Jews were targeted by the Reich. In the winter of 1939–40, about 100,000 Jews were thus deported to Poland. They were initially gathered into massive urban ghettos, such as <a0_0><b5_0>380,000<b5_0/><a0_0/> held in the Warsaw Ghetto, where large numbers died under the harsh conditions therein, including <a1_0><b6_0>43,000<b6_0/><a1_0/> in the Warsaw Ghetto alone. Poles and ethnic Jews were imprisoned in nearly every camp of the extensive concentration camp system in German-occupied Poland and the Reich. In Auschwitz, which began operating on 14 June 1940, <a4_0><b9_0>1.1 million people<a4_0/> died<b9_0/>.
